Hey John,

I am building a test application with Angular. The goal is to test the feasibility of rebuilding an old, heavy PowerBuilder application as a web application.

I found your Angular JS Style Guide and loved it. Thanks for the great work!

At first, I started playing with Angular 1.3 – and then came 1.4 and now 2.0 with Web Components – which looks awesome, especially thinking about separation of concerns and making the application more loosely coupled. Then there is Aurelia, JSBlocks and what more popping up every night. I am left a bit puzzled as to the nature of today’s web development.

Is there no “Angular JS Component Framework” that lets me just focus on the business logic when developing web applications – or do I constantly have to care about the ever-changing world of web and constantly have to patchwork every new application with an endless stream of better-than-the-other components?

I thought I had found an answer in Telerik Kendo UI, but after having struggled with for a while, I finally abandonned it and started using the Angular UI components. What I’d like to see is a complete component set with everything I need to build applications - so that I can focus on the business logic and not hacking components.
